definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
(onom.) to rumble (of a stomach)/to coo (of a dove)/rumbling/noisy drinking sound
see 嘰哩咕嚕|叽哩咕噜[ji1 li5 gu1 lu1]
bunch/cluster/classifier for bunched objects/to hang down in a bunch/to droop
Mongolian daruqachi, local commander in Mongol and Yuan times

sentences.english: Pablo made a swishing noise rinsing wine in his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 巴勃羅用酒漱着口，發出咕嚕嚕嚕的聲音。

sentences.english: And the guy says, "Did this little piggy say wee wee wee all the way home?"
sentences.chinese: 那個人就說，“這些小豬回家一路上都說嚕嚕嚕嗎？”

sentences.english: A sea song sweet and clear Loo loo.
sentences.chinese: 一首海洋之歌甜美而清晰嚕嚕。

sentences.english: A sea song sweet and clear Loo loo.
sentences.chinese: 一首海洋之歌甜美而清晰嚕嚕。

sentences.english: Lu Ni likes to eat bananas.
But her endless chatter destroys the connection.
sentences.chinese: 但她無盡嚕嚕搗毀聯繫。

sentences.english: But her endless chatter destroys the connection.
sentences.chinese: 但她無盡嚕嚕搗毀聯繫。

definition: (final particle equivalent to 了[le5])/(particle calling attention to, or mildly warning of, a situation)
(interj. of admiration or of disgust)/to click one's tongue/to attempt to (find an opportunity to) speak
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
original poster (in an online forum)/landlord of a building (traditional)
(onom.) sound of cawing/sound of infant learning to talk/variant of 呀[ya1]
